result.execSummary:
The defendant Leland Berg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All monies owed to be collected by DOC due within the probation period on count #3 in case 14CF56.
Defendant must submit DNA sample if one has not been previously submitted with the surcharge assessed.

Good time and huber allowed.

Community service authorized under 973.03(3).
Consecutive to: Brown county case currently serving.

miscConds.notes: The defendant must take all medications as prescribed and only as prescribed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence the defendant may be currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes: $1,651.00 to be collected from any prison wages or accounts at the maxium allowable amount. Any balance due after prison sentence, must be collected through extended supervision.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence that the defendant may currently be serving.

02:40 PM Defendant Leland Berg in court with attorney Beth Svehlek.  Defendant Leland Berg in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State - here for sentencing revocacation. Svehlek believes jail credit is incorrect on paperwork. Discussion between parties and court regarding jail credit. No other inacurracies indicated. State recites criminal history and is asking for 6 years, 3 years of initial confinement and 3 years of extended supervision - consecutive to any sentence he may currently be serving. Svehlek makes argument and is asking one year in the FC jail, concurrent with any other sentence, with 220 days of jail credit. Berg makes statement, remorseful. Court - sentences to the following: 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prision with 2 years of incarrceration and 2 years of extended supervision - consecutive to any sentence he may be currently serving, credit for 55 days, payment of costs part of extended supervision and to be deducted from wages or accounts at the maxium allowable amount. Appeal rights given. Court does not authorize any programming.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 14, 2019 at 02:30 pm.
Warrant detainer - Brown Co

Defendant Leland Berg in court/custody on loan from Brown County with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:46 am. Here for continuation of plea. Burns makes statement to credit - sitting on brown co case 180 days as of 5/20/14 no credit on that case and asking for 10 days credit on count 2 in this case. Court agrees as does the state. Count 2 pleads G, Count 3 pleads G both with domestic enhancers. Count 1 & 4 DRI. Court DRI's in count 1 & 4. Court goes thru plea questionnarie and finds waiving his constiutional right to JT by entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently, factual basis, adjudges guility of count 2 & 3 as alleged. State has complied with victim notification follow joint recommendation/Burns final argument to sentencing follow joint recommendation. Berg makes statement. Court proceed to sentencing: Count 2 -  $500 plus costs and DNA surcharge, paid  thru probation on count 3 - 60 days jail consecutive to brown county case, 10 days credit with huber and good time, com service 973.03(3). Count 3 w/hold and 3 years probation, AODA, all meds as prescribed, 200 hrs co service, costs and DNA surcharge (felony), if no sample must submit one with surcharge.  Voting rights and appeal rights given. Burns will be released from Brown Co mid October and asking for report of Nov 1st for Forest Co case. Court denies that request for stated reasons. Adj 9:02 am.
PLEAS - September 5, 2014
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Called at 4:00 PM. Leland Berg appears in person and in custody with Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - resolved - has complied with victim notification requirements and provides court with it. Court reviews letter from victim. State informs the Court that the victim was not notified of today's date but has never had any response from any previous notices. Court satisfied with State's efforts. State - defendant would plead G to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, DRI counts #1 and #4, count #2 - fine of $500 plus costs and surcharges, 60 days in FC jail - consecutive to any other jail he is currently serving; count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: costs and surcharges, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobirety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, employment/school, 200 hours of community service, take all meds as prescribed by treating physician or medical provider, no contact with the victim except as court ordered for child custody or as allowed by P&P. Burns makes statement regarding the no contact condition and states she was not aware that the jail time on count #2 was consecutive to current jail time. State shows Ms. Burns that condition on the plea agreement. Burns now argues for some credit on this matter - at least 30 days. Burns now wants an adjournment until Friday. Court continues bond, set for another PLEAS on 9/5/14 at 8:30 AM. Burns to let Court know if the defendant does not agree to joint recommendation as it is currently set for JT on 9/12/14.

Defendant Leland Berg in court and in custody with attorney Mary L Burns.  Jodie L Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:00 PM. State calls Chad Mullis, sworn in 4:01 PM. Direct by state. Objection - heresay - noted - overruled. Objection - sustained 4:05 PM. Record reflects the defendant has been identified 4:08 PM. Cross exam by Attorney Burns 4:16 PM. Re-direct by Bendar 4:19 PM. Witness excused 4:20 PM. Burns makes final argument, doesn't believe state has met burden of proof. Objection - sustained. State disagrees and makes final argument. Court finds probable cause, bind over for trial. State files Information which mirrors the complaint. Defendant waives further reading, defendant enters NG pleas on all counts. Court accepts NG pleas. Burns asks for signature bond. State objects, wants some cash bond. Court $2500 signature bond.

Preliminary hearing on June 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:01 AM. Leland Berg appears in person and in custody without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. State provides defendant with complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Berg understands charges, wants an attorney, cannot afford his own - already contacted SPD and they informed him that someone wold be here today for him. Recess to call SPD. Recalled at 1:23 PM. Leland Berg appears via video from FOSO and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH and would like to address bond prior to making decision on waiving time limits. Burns - bond - makes argument for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to reduction in bond for stated reasons. Berg - lives at 10187 Cypress Street, Argonne, WI  54511. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $500 cash with same conditions. Court sets PH on 6/11/14 at 3:00 PM - must go thru procedure to get no-contact provision lifted.
